job_details.Functieomschrijving:
As a Software Engineer IV, you will work with the seniors of the team, and with Product Managers and Designers and build delightful features and products for our community, as well as the thousands of companies who trust HackerOne with their cybersecurity posture.

   You are a collaborative and effective software engineer and team member. You will interact with CSM's, who are the voice of our customers. You will guide and coach the more junior IC's.

   You'll combine your technological expertise, domain knowledge, and an unquestionable dedication to business objectives as you intersect with the engineering organization. You identify and make systematic improvements to technical weaknesses you'll find in your squad's codebases, and in shared codebases across the company.

   Your Journey at HackerOne
     * Your day will start with a warm welcome online and get your tools to start!
     * Your first 30 days will be focusing on getting to know our HackerOnies. You will join your new squad and being onboarded - get to learn the technology stack (Ruby on Rails + GraphQL + ReactJS + many more)
     * Within 60 days, you will have committed a bunch of code to our repositories and will start developing a knack for being a fast and effective software engineer on our codebase
     * Within 90 days, you will start getting ready to lead your first project as Software Engineer - you will have branched out and talked to Sales, Marketing and various other functions, and developed a good sense of cross-functional collaboration and communication
     * Beyond 90 days, you will be a fully-fledged software engineer
     * By that time you will be able to understand the business value of our products and features, and the needs of our customers
     * And you are able to translate feature requests into simple, but robust engineering (or non-engineering) solutions
job_details.full_text:
Software Engineer IV

As a Software Engineer IV, you will work with the seniors of the team, and with Product Managers and Designers and build delightful features and products for our community, as well as the thousands of companies who trust HackerOne with their cybersecurity posture.

   You are a collaborative and effective software engineer and team member. You will interact with CSM's, who are the voice of our customers. You will guide and coach the more junior IC's.

   You'll combine your technological expertise, domain knowledge, and an unquestionable dedication to business objectives as you intersect with the engineering organization. You identify and make systematic improvements to technical weaknesses you'll find in your squad's codebases, and in shared codebases across the company.

   Your Journey at HackerOne
     * Your day will start with a warm welcome online and get your tools to start!
     * Your first 30 days will be focusing on getting to know our HackerOnies. You will join your new squad and being onboarded - get to learn the technology stack (Ruby on Rails + GraphQL + ReactJS + many more)
     * Within 60 days, you will have committed a bunch of code to our repositories and will start developing a knack for being a fast and effective software engineer on our codebase
     * Within 90 days, you will start getting ready to lead your first project as Software Engineer - you will have branched out and talked to Sales, Marketing and various other functions, and developed a good sense of cross-functional collaboration and communication
     * Beyond 90 days, you will be a fully-fledged software engineer
     * By that time you will be able to understand the business value of our products and features, and the needs of our customers
     * And you are able to translate feature requests into simple, but robust engineering (or non-engineering) solutions

profile_classification.rationale: The job description focuses heavily on traditional software engineering, product development, and team collaboration without mentioning any specific AI, ML, or generative models. It lacks the core technical elements required for ML Engineer or GenAI Engineer profiles.

job_tasks.phrase: build delightful features and products for our community, as well as the thousands of companies who trust HackerOne with their cybersecurity posture.
job_tasks.justification: This phrase describes the core activity of building user-facing products and features, which falls under traditional software development.

job_tasks.phrase: You are a collaborative and effective software engineer and team member.
job_tasks.justification: This explicitly states the need for collaboration and effectiveness as a team member, aligning with communication and collaboration skills.

job_tasks.phrase: You will interact with CSM's, who are the voice of our customers.
job_tasks.justification: Interacting with customer-facing roles (CSMs) to understand customer needs is a key aspect of business understanding and translating those needs into technical solutions.

job_tasks.phrase: You will guide and coach the more junior IC's.
job_tasks.justification: Guiding and coaching junior engineers implies taking ownership and leadership within the team, which aligns with innovation and ownership.

job_tasks.phrase: You'll combine your technological expertise, domain knowledge, and an unquestionable dedication to business objectives as you intersect with the engineering organization.
job_tasks.justification: This highlights the integration of technical skills with business objectives and domain knowledge, a core component of business understanding.

job_tasks.phrase: You identify and make systematic improvements to technical weaknesses you'll find in your squad's codebases, and in shared codebases across the company.
job_tasks.justification: Identifying and improving technical weaknesses in codebases is a fundamental software development task focused on code quality and maintainability.

job_tasks.phrase: get to learn the technology stack (Ruby on Rails + GraphQL + ReactJS + many more)
job_tasks.justification: This lists specific programming languages and frameworks used in the technology stack.

job_tasks.phrase: committed a bunch of code to our repositories
job_tasks.justification: Committing code to repositories is a direct activity within software development.

job_tasks.phrase: developing a knack for being a fast and effective software engineer on our codebase
job_tasks.justification: This emphasizes the development of skills related to being an effective software engineer, focusing on speed and efficiency in coding.

job_tasks.phrase: lead your first project as Software Engineer
job_tasks.justification: Leading a project indicates taking initiative and ownership, aligning with this soft skill.

job_tasks.phrase: talked to Sales, Marketing and various other functions, and developed a good sense of cross-functional collaboration and communication
job_tasks.justification: This explicitly mentions cross-functional collaboration and communication with various departments.

job_tasks.phrase: understand the business value of our products and features, and the needs of our customers
job_tasks.justification: Understanding business value and customer needs is central to business understanding.

job_tasks.phrase: translate feature requests into simple, but robust engineering (or non-engineering) solutions
job_tasks.justification: Translating feature requests into solutions, considering both engineering and non-engineering aspects, requires a strong understanding of business needs and problem-solving.

soft_skills.phrase: collaborative and effective software engineer and team member
guide and coach the more junior IC's
understand the business value of our products and features, and the needs of our customers
translate feature requests into simple, but robust engineering (or non-engineering) solutions
